Dara meets Dr Katie Joy who studies moon rocks brought back from the Apollo missions to find out what they discovered from them and are still discovering. Katie explains there is a new race to the moon because, incredibly, locked up in rocks across the lunar surface is believed to be vast amounts of water.

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Deadly 60 is a British wildlife documentary series aimed at children. It follows zoologist Steve Backshall, as he travels the world with his camera crew, introducing some of the worlds deadliest creatures, from insects and reptiles, to huge mammal predators. Watch him as he explores the traits of these animals, and find out which are the ones he considers the most dangerous. His selection includes wolfs, leopards , anacondas, crocodiles and sharks, but also some surprises like giant ants, sea lions and squids.

programme.title: Maailma kauneimad rongiteed
programme.desc: This is a scenic railway journey like no other. Celebrating the wonders of Queensland, Australia, we travel over 1,000 miles from Brisbane to Cairns onboard one of the most advanced trains in the world. On our journey, we take the chance to stop off at a rum distillery in Bundaberg and spot a duck-billed platypus near Gympie, before riding on the historic Mary Valley line. Further north, well take off with the Royal Flying Doctor Service in Townsville, before meeting the cowboys at one of Australias largest cattle markets. At Rockhampton, well dive down to discover an underwater art gallery in the Great Barrier Reef, before heading to the rainforests of Cairns for a ride on the incredible Kuranda Scenic Railway.

programme.title: Pisikeste pikk reis
programme.desc: Laane-Madagaskari metsas algab uks kummalisemaid teekondi. Imetilluke asja sundinud kameeleon peab kiiresti kasvama piisavalt suureks, et ise jarglasi saada. Šoti magismaal elav mugri hulgab mingi eest põgenedes oma kodu ja peab uue elukoha leidma.

programme.title: Elu allpool nulli
programme.desc: Jessie Holmes veetis suure osa talvest koeri treenides ja nendega võisteldes. Hooaeg on nuud lõppenud, ent paadiga jõele veel ei paase ja Jessie valmistub sulaks. Kaviki jõe laager on Alaska põhjaosa uks vahestest tanklatest ja hadasadamatest. Lennukid on varsti saabumas ja lennurada tuleb hiljuti tormiga sadanud lumest puhtaks teha. Hailstoneid on talv labi karibuliha soonud ja suunduvad nuud hanejahile. Edward ei lase ebaõnnestunud jahil end heidutada ja loodab edukalt saagiga naasta. Huslias on paevad samuti pikemad ja talvest saab tasahilju kevad. Ricko suundub eluks vajalike varude jarele.

programme.title: Kus on metsikud mehed?
programme.desc: Ben Fogle explores and follows the same path that various individuals have walked. Having willingly forsaken the luxuries and lifestyle that the modern world has to offer, Ben Fogle explores the less-than-ordinary life that people have swapped to in the wilderness. Many of these destinations are primarily "off the grid" in some of the most remote locations on earth, including Georgia Swamplands USA, Swedish Arctic Circle, Wilderness Island Australia and the Sahara Desert. Men, either alone or with a family, sacrifice the comforts and almost any social life to experience the hardships, challenges and rewards of a life that is constantly challenged by nature and be at one with nature. Being largely dependant on their own abilities, Ben Fogle experiences their way of living for a week to understand the reasons behind why they chose this new way of living. Released on Channel 5 in the UK, Ben Fogle: New Lives in the Wild was produced by Motion Content Group and Renegade Pictures.

programme.title: Kus on metsikud mehed?
programme.desc: Documentary series in which adventurer Ben Fogle meets people who have given up the rat race to start a new life in the wilderness. In this opening episode, Ben journeys to the swamplands of south Georgia in the USA, to live with 64-year-old Colbert, a former city fat cat earning big bucks in the world of high finance, who has turned Tarzan. Colbert now lives in his hand-built wooden cabin, totally off the grid and with no toilet - a far cry from the luxurious pad he used to own.

programme.title: Maailma kauneimad rongiteed
programme.desc: This is a scenic railway journey like no other. Celebrating the wonders of Queensland, Australia, we travel over 1,000 miles from Brisbane to Cairns onboard one of the most advanced trains in the world. On our journey, we take the chance to stop off at a rum distillery in Bundaberg and spot a duck-billed platypus near Gympie, before riding on the historic Mary Valley line. Further north, well take off with the Royal Flying Doctor Service in Townsville, before meeting the cowboys at one of Australias largest cattle markets. At Rockhampton, well dive down to discover an underwater art gallery in the Great Barrier Reef, before heading to the rainforests of Cairns for a ride on the incredible Kuranda Scenic Railway.

programme.title: Wonders of the Solar System
programme.desc: Professor Brian Cox visits some of the most stunning locations on earth to describe how the laws of nature have carved natural wonders across the solar system. In this first episode Brian explores the powerhouse of them all, the sun. In India he witnesses a total solar eclipse - when the link to the light and heat that sustains us is cut off for a few precious minutes. But heat and light are not the only power of the sun over the solar system. In Norway, Brian watches the battle between the suns wind and earth, as the night sky glows with the northern lights. Beyond earth, the solar wind continues, creating dazzling aurora on other planets. Brian makes contact with Voyager, a probe that has been travelling since its launch 30 years ago. Now 14 billion kilometres away, Voyager has just detected the solar wind is beginning to peter out. But even here we havent reached the end of the suns rule. Brian explains how its greatest power, gravity, reaches out for hundreds of billions of kilometres, where the lightest gravitational touch encircles our solar system in a mysterious cloud of comets.

programme.title: Põhja-Atland
programme.desc: Underwater cameraman Ken OSullivan explores the marine life of the northern part of the ocean, beginning with the dark waters off the coast of the north of Ireland in winter.

programme.title: Elu allpool nulli
programme.desc: Alaska is one of the least populated states in the US where winter can last up to 9 months and temperatures can drop to below minus 62 degrees Celsius. Life Below Zero follows the lives of seven people as they face the everyday struggles of living in the middle of nowhere with limited resources, battling the elements, frozen terrain and ferocious wildlife, in a fight for survival. Surviving in this merciless land is a test of mental strength as much as it is physical, as the inhabitants must endure crippling isolation and the constant work required, where one wrong decision could cost you your life.

programme.title: Kus on metsikud mehed?
programme.desc: Unistame kõik aeg-ajalt oma paevatoost loobumisest ja tanapaeva elu saginast eemale kolimisest. Ent mõned inimesed viivad oma kõige eest põgenemise iha aarmustesse. Selles seriaalis kohtub seikleja Ben Fogle inimestega, kes on keeranud selja laane uhiskonna tunnustele ja loonud kodu mõnedes maakera eraldatuimates paikades.

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace is inside one of the worlds largest chocolate factories in York to discover how they produce a staggering 7 million bars a day. Hell follow the incredible 24 hour journey - from bean to bar - of one of our best-selling chocolates and meet the team of people who work around the clock to keep up with that demand.Cherry Healey gets hands on with the hundreds of workers on a production line in Derbyshire where the millions of chocolate boxes they produce every year are still surprisingly hand made.And historian Ruth Goodman delves through the chocolate archives to find out what it was like working in the factories before the machines took over, and meet the people who found love on the production line.

programme.title: Planet Earth III
programme.desc: In the baked Namib desert, a pair of ostriches raise their family in the searing heat to keep them safe from predators - but time is ticking as the chicks begin to hatch. Outside of the egg, the newborns wont survive long in these temperatures, but not all of the clutch hatch at once. For the whole brood to survive, the parents need to time their departure perfectly, but tragically they are forced to leave behind a single unhatched egg. As the family depart, the newborn emerges and the lone chick wanders the vast Namib desert calling for its family. In the desert, life exists in a world with almost no water, and it drives one troop of desert baboons on a continual quest to find it. A young mother who is low in the pecking order must battle for her right to drink - her newborns life depends on it. Without water, her milk will run dry. As climatic change causes deserts around the world to expand, dust storms towering up to a mile high and travelling at speeds of up to 70mph overwhelm entire cities in an instant. Where rain falls regularly, it can transform a desert, turning it into one of earths most productive landscapes - grasslands. Grasslands support the biggest concentrations of large animals on the planet. This wealth of life, in turn, attracts predators. Leopards are the most adaptable of the big cats, and a handful of special individuals have learned to hunt by hiding and leaping from treetops, some higher than the roof of a two-storey house. Their lives depend on them getting this unique game of hide-and-seek right, and when they do, their prey doesnt see them coming. Grasslands are one of the most widespread habitats on earth, and in the frozen north, herds of alien-like saiga antelope fight for their chance to win mating rights. Seventy per cent of rutting males die every year in battles that have been taking place since the ice age. Closer to the equator, a grassland paradise can be found - the Cerrado in Brazil. This is the richest grassland on earth and home to the rare, fruit-eating maned wolf. Little is known about this bizarre creature, and for the first time, we glimpse inside the den of wild maned wolf. A mother raises her three puppies, but their future is uncertain. The Cerrado is a vitally important grassland - home to thousands of species of plants and animals found nowhere else - and it is in danger of being lost forever. This grassland is being destroyed more than two times faster than the Amazon rainforest to clear land for farming. Reduced to 50 per cent of its former size, some predict it could disappear completely in the next 30 years. But there is hope. In central Africa, one of the worlds most spectacular wildlife gatherings is testament to what can happen if we help protect these precious ecosystems and allow nature to restore its own balance.

programme.title: Elu allpool nulli
programme.desc: Alaska elanikud kiirustavad, et enne kulmade tulekut talviste ettevalmistustega uhele poole saada. Sue laagris luusivad karud ja vaatamata kuus aastat tagasi toimunud karurunnakule tuleb Suel oma hirmudega silmitsi seista. Kateil ja Andyl on kalad otsas ning kõige olulisema talvevaru hankimiseks lastakse jõkke kalaratas. Noorvikis põhjustab liiga soe ilm aga segadust ja Hailstoneidel on talveks valmistumisega raskusi. Eriku giiditoo on selleks aastaks labi ja ta suundub kõrvalistele aladele jahti pidama. Rinda tuleb pista ohtliku maastiku, raju ilma ja ringi luusivate karudega.

programme.title: Kus on metsikud mehed?
programme.desc: Ben Fogle explores and follows the same path that various individuals have walked. Having willingly forsaken the luxuries and lifestyle that the modern world has to offer, Ben Fogle explores the less-than-ordinary life that people have swapped to in the wilderness. Being largely dependant on their own abilities, Ben Fogle experiences their way of living for a week to understand the reasons behind why they chose this new way of living. Released on Channel 5 in the UK, Ben Fogle: New Lives in the Wild was produced by Motion Content Group and Renegade Pictures.

programme.title: Worlds Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: A pair of celebrities prepare to tackle some of the worlds most dangerous roads in this documentary series fraught with danger, delight and, with several comedians taking on the challenge, plenty of humour. Each episode sees a different pair of famous faces team up and traverse a hazardous route across difficult terrain. These potentially deadly routes dissect dramatic mountain ranges, sweltering jungles, desolate deserts and icy highways, encompassing some our planets most spectacular landscapes. Duos have included Hugh Bonneville and Jessica Hynes, as they navigate their way through Georgia, Marcus Brigstoke and Phil Jupitus, broadening their horizons of Bolivia, and Rhod Gilbert and Greg Davies, who weave through the stunning Himalayas.

programme.title: Eatute saladused
programme.desc: Terves kehas on teatavasti terve vaim, kuid kui turjal on 75 eluaastat, ei pruugi keha enam kuigi terve olla. Dr Mosley kohtub nii ulisportlike pensionaridega kui ka vananemist uurivate teadlastega, selgitamaks valja, millised toidud, hobid ja spordialad aitavad inimestel ka kõrges eas heas vormis olla ning aktiivselt elada.

programme.title: Simon Reeves Return to Cornwall
programme.desc: Simon Reeve returns to visit one of Britains favourite counties to discover what life is really like for the locals after the summer crowds have gone. Filmed as the energy and cost-of-living crisis began to take its toll, this is an eye-opening look at why Cornwall is one of the most desirable parts of the country and an iconic holiday destination but also one of the poorest counties in England.

programme.title: Deadly Mission Shark
programme.desc: In this episode, the team journey to Rainbow Reef, where they face their next dive tasks. With some still struggling, theres a long way to go. With training over, and the team split up, Steve takes some for a shallow-water shark experience with the timid black tips, a perfect shark for novices. Meanwhile, Skyla, one of the Bahamian shark saviours, persuades the rest of the UK team to join her rehearsals for the annual Junkanoo, one of the Caribbeans most celebrated carnivals.

programme.title: Kus on metsikud mehed?
programme.desc: Adventurer Ben Fogle is back, joining a variety of brave individuals who chose to venture down a very alternative path to everyday life. Ben wants to discover the reality of leaving it all behind, and meets those whove chosen to ditch a life dominated by debts and daily grind and go in search of something different. In this episode, Ben visits musician Vanessa Forero. He finds out what took his host from her native Yorkshire to life on a remote South American mountainside, and hears of the events that bind Vanessa to Colombias violent past, and how her beautiful home is helping heal her own wounds. Ben meets Vanessa deep into the Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta, an isolated mountain range in the north of the country. He discovers her magical home, a once overgrown cow pasture but now an idyllic mountain sanctuary. Together they tackle home improvements on the steep mountainside, from a new cable car to building walls, and they receive a visit from an indigenous leader. Ben helps Vanessa compose music and hears one of the most extraordinary survival stories hes ever heard.

programme.title: Kus on metsikud mehed?
programme.desc: Ben ventures to Great Blasket Island off the coast of Ireland where he stays with Dan and Emily, an ordinary London couple who landed an extraordinary job: island caretakers on Europes rugged western frontier. Beating 40,000 other applicants, Ben discovers how the couple have adapted to life as castaways, what theyve achieved with no real experience, and where this leap of faith might take them next. Ben gets stuck in fixing a water pump, catching sheep, foraging seaweed and swimming with seals in the Atlantics clear waters. He gets a glimpse into the islands extraordinary past, meets the man who picked Dan and Emily to run the island, and together they all navigate the precarious way to get supplies onto the island. Surrounded by cliffs and battered by storms, Ben discovers that Great Blasket Island is a place that nourishes the spirit and reminds us of the power of nature.

programme.title: Moodsa aja geniaalsed alustalad
programme.desc: Headphones: these marvels of miniaturisation are worn by over 30 million people in the UK. Hannah Fry visits legendary headphone honchos Bose to find out how todays teeny earbud tech works and meets the human testers with golden ears. She discovers how helicopters in the Korean War helped put the "shhh" into noise-cancelling, why it took a muted Mormon church service to get headphones onto peoples heads, and how an opera singers electric shock therapy led to the invention of the speaker.

programme.title: Maakera suured jõed
programme.desc: Labi Euroopa voolav võimas ja majesteetlik Doonau labib oma teel rohkem riike kui ukski teine maailma jõgi ja tema lisajõed saavad vett koguni uheksateistkumnest riigist. Doonau voolab labi magiste metsade ja muistsete kuningriikide ning muutub oma teel ohtlikeks karestikeks. Doonau on jõgede kuninganna, mis pakub igal kaanakul uusi ullatusi.

programme.title: Elu allpool nulli
programme.desc: Alaskalased kasutavad pikki suvepaevi, et valmistuda pikaks talveks. Kiwalikis korjatakse soogiks põliseid tavasid jargides jõe aarest kajakamune. Sue uletab jõe ja suundub kalale. Glenn ronib mae otsa kitsi kuttima ja ehitab varjendi. Andy võtab kasile aga uue too ja pustitab koos noore kulalisega jurta.

programme.title: Lõuna-Korea koos Alexander Armstrongiga
programme.desc: Arriving late at night in bustling downtown Seoul, Alexander kicks off his epic Korean adventure in Gangnam, the fabled district immortalised by Psys Gangnam Style video, still the most viewed song on YouTube. Gangnam is where Seouls fast and furious like to hang out, purring down the main drag in their supercars, serenaded by the booming beats of the 24-hour stores and bars. Alexander soaks up the buzz before calling it a night. Taking in the stunning views from the Namsang Tower, Alexander marvels at the Seoul cityscape, home to 26 million Koreans. Thats half the population of the whole country, which is smaller than England but whose influence stretches worldwide. Helping to keep modern Korea on the global map are its YouTube stars, and Alexander wolfs down noodles with Heebab, a record-breaking Mukhbang bulk-eater, and meets Korean Billy, whose English accent impersonations are an online sensation, washed down with tea from a toilet-shaped mug in an outrageous poo-themed cafe. Then, Alexander is granted every K-Pop fans ultimate wish, meeting the band hotly tipped to be South Koreas next K-Pop megastars: Stay-C. Winners of numerous Korean TV awards, Stay-C have been years in the making and training — and are now one of the most popular girl bands in Korea. They share their secrets with Alexander, giving him a nickname in the bands tradition and the inside track on how to dance like a K-Pop superstar. Escaping the bustle of Seoul, Alexander finds an altogether different place — a spectacular monastery where Koreans explore the experience of leaving this earth. At the Death Experience School, Alexander is given his own coffin as he contemplates his own life — and death. A hugely emotional and personal experience, any scepticism is immediately banished. Returning to Gangnam, Alexander finds himself at a tower full of plastic surgery clinics. Korean men are increasingly embracing both surgery and make-up. Here, he also learns the inside secrets of the K-Pop stars look, before he gets the chance to record a song with a top producer. And meeting up with the friends he has made in Seoul, he tests out his talent at a noraebang — a Korean karaoke room.

programme.title: Attenborough and the Jurassic Sea Monster
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the discovery of a lifetime, a giant prehistoric skull, found in the cliffs of Dorset. It belongs to the pliosaur, the tyrannosaurus rex of the seas, a huge and mysterious sea monster.

programme.title: Elu allpool nulli
programme.desc: Alaska is one of the least populated states in the US where winter can last up to 9 months and temperatures can drop to below minus 62 degrees Celsius. Surviving in this merciless land is a test of mental strength as much as it is physical, as the inhabitants must endure crippling isolation and the constant work required, where one wrong decision could cost you your life.

programme.title: Ben Fogle
programme.desc: Interesting documentary series in which Ben Fogle, English broadcaster, writer and adventurer, revisits some of the extraordinary people that were featured in his show Ben Fogle: New Lives in the Wild- people who have chosen to live in the wild and isolated from society. He will revisit some of Earths most remote locations- remote island in Australia, canyons of Utah, Hungarian countryside, India,... to see how some of them have been getting on since he first met them, did they change their ways and what challenges they have overcome.

programme.title: NASAs Mega Rocket
programme.desc: NASAs SLS is the most powerful rocket ever built, capable of sending astronauts to Mars and beyond. The first un-crewed mission around the Moon, in March 2022, will be a giant leap forward for human deep-space exploration, if all goes to plan. Construction has been beset with difficulties, delays and cost over-runs. Featuring interviews with the trailblazers behind the project, archive and nail-biting on-location sequences, its a unique record of space history in the making.

programme.title: Maailma kauneimad rongiteed
programme.desc: Winding through Sweden, Alaska, the far north of Scotland, the Welsh Borders, Northumbria, Edinburgh and Australia, we take you on some magnificent railway journeys. Our magical mid-summer railway journey through central Sweden starts in Mora on the Inlandsbanan. This traditional town is in the county of Dalarna, the heart of Swedish traditional culture and often known as Sweden in miniature. As we learn about the famous Falun red houses and Dala painted horses, we celebrate midsummers eve with traditional dancing and flowers. Inlandsbanan is a unique train: its an Italianbuilt single rail car that runs only 10 weeks a year in the height of summer, and just one train a day in each direction on its 663-milelong route. This two-day ride is a rare gem of Swedens beautiful railways, as its the journey itself that is most important and not just keeping to a schedule. It is also special in another way — the train stops for refreshments, for passengers to enjoy the view and see the wildlife. Being delayed by elks and reindeer is all part of the incredible experience on this trip as well as reaching its final destination of Gallivare, which we reach only after crossing the Arctic Circle. Our train also makes regular stops for refreshments. Fika is a traditional treat of locally made cinnamon buns and coffee. We also learn about Swedish sav, a sparkling wine made out of birch sap, and how fir is used to smoke salmon deep in Laplands rich forests. And we stop to forage with Eva, a herb and foraging expert, in her wild pantry as she makes glug, a special herb and berry tea. This special Swedish slow train adventure is all about the journey and making sure there is time to linger as well as reach the great Arctic wilderness.

programme.title: Worlds Deadliest Weather
programme.desc: This terrifying documentary series takes a look at some of the worlds strangest, strongest and most severe weather conditions. Real life footage captures not just the event itself but the chaos and destruction that the worlds deadliest weather leaves in its wake. Hold onto your hats as we watch how a horrifying tornado rips through Missouri, wiping out 200 houses a minute, immediately followed by ferocious flames as Tennessees Great Smoky Mountains live up to their names. If theres one thing this show teaches us, its dont mess with mother nature.

programme.title: Tutankhamun with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Documentary series in which host, British historian Dan Snow, together with archaeologist Raksha Dave and journalist John Sargeant, tells the incredible tale of life, death and rediscovery of young pharaoh - Tutankhamun. The trio will embark on a journey across beautiful Egypt and use new technology and archeological finds, in order to tell the story and reveal King Tuts secrets. Dont miss a chance to be amazed and surprised, and find out something new about the famous boy-king.

programme.title: Elu allpool nulli
programme.desc: Alaska is one of the least populated states in the US where winter can last up to 9 months and temperatures can drop to below minus 62 degrees Celsius. Life Below Zero follows the lives of seven people as they face the everyday struggles of living in the middle of nowhere with limited resources, battling the elements, frozen terrain and ferocious wildlife, in a fight for survival. Surviving in this merciless land is a test of mental strength as much as it is physical, as the inhabitants must endure crippling isolation and the constant work required, where one wrong decision could cost you your life.

programme.title: Ben Fogle
programme.desc: Interesting documentary series in which Ben Fogle, English broadcaster, writer and adventurer, revisits some of the extraordinary people that were featured in his show Ben Fogle: New Lives in the Wild- people who have chosen to live in the wild and isolated from society. He will revisit some of Earths most remote locations- remote island in Australia, canyons of Utah, Hungarian countryside, India,... to see how some of them have been getting on since he first met them, did they change their ways and what challenges they have overcome.

programme.title: NASAs Mega Rocket
programme.desc: NASAs SLS is the most powerful rocket ever built, capable of sending astronauts to Mars and beyond. The first un-crewed mission around the Moon, in March 2022, will be a giant leap forward for human deep-space exploration, if all goes to plan. Construction has been beset with difficulties, delays and cost over-runs. Featuring interviews with the trailblazers behind the project, archive and nail-biting on-location sequences, its a unique record of space history in the making.

programme.title: Maailma kauneimad rongiteed
programme.desc: Winding through Sweden, Alaska, the far north of Scotland, the Welsh Borders, Northumbria, Edinburgh and Australia, we take you on some magnificent railway journeys. And we stop to forage with Eva, a herb and foraging expert, in her wild pantry as she makes glug, a special herb and berry tea. This special Swedish slow train adventure is all about the journey and making sure there is time to linger as well as reach the great Arctic wilderness.

programme.title: Worlds Deadliest Weather
programme.desc: This terrifying documentary series takes a look at some of the worlds strangest, strongest and most severe weather conditions. Real life footage captures not just the event itself but the chaos and destruction that the worlds deadliest weather leaves in its wake. Hold onto your hats as we watch how a horrifying tornado rips through Missouri, wiping out 200 houses a minute, immediately followed by ferocious flames as Tennessees Great Smoky Mountains live up to their names. If theres one thing this show teaches us, its dont mess with mother nature.

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Deadly 60 is a British wildlife documentary series aimed at children. It follows zoologist Steve Backshall, as he travels the world with his camera crew, introducing some of the worlds deadliest creatures, from insects and reptiles, to huge mammal predators. Watch him as he explores the traits of these animals, and find out which are the ones he considers the most dangerous. His selection includes wolfs, leopards , anacondas, crocodiles and sharks, but also some surprises like giant ants, sea lions and squids.

programme.title: Kus on metsikud mehed?
programme.desc: Ben ventures to Great Blasket Island off the coast of Ireland where he stays with Dan and Emily, an ordinary London couple who landed an extraordinary job: island caretakers on Europes rugged western frontier. Beating 40,000 other applicants, Ben discovers how the couple have adapted to life as castaways, what theyve achieved with no real experience, and where this leap of faith might take them next. Ben gets stuck in fixing a water pump, catching sheep, foraging seaweed and swimming with seals in the Atlantics clear waters. He gets a glimpse into the islands extraordinary past, meets the man who picked Dan and Emily to run the island, and together they all navigate the precarious way to get supplies onto the island. Surrounded by cliffs and battered by storms, Ben discovers that Great Blasket Island is a place that nourishes the spirit and reminds us of the power of nature.

programme.title: BBC World News America
programme.desc: News presenter Katty Kay keeps you up to date with all the latest breaking news from America and the rest of the world on BBC World News America. This world renowned news and current affairs program has been recognised for its exceptional reporting at the Emmy Awards. BBC World News America won two Emmy awards for its coverage of the conflicts in Syria and the Central African Republic. You can catch up with this award winning broadcast team as they air multiple times a day throughout the week.

programme.title: HARDtalk
programme.desc: Stephen Sackur is the main host of the legendary HARDtalk interview programme on a one-on-one basis. He has interviewed prominent international personalities including presidents and prime ministers of several countries, leading cultural figures, scientists, actors, influencers. The other presenters are Zeinab Badawi and Sarah Montague. HARDtalk is the proper name for the show, the issues being discussed are very essential and sensitive, and often the questions are not the easiest to answer. The hosts are genuine experts who always get to the core of every topic, get all the answers from the guests so that the viewers see the whole picture.

programme.title: BBC World News America
programme.desc: News presenter Katty Kay keeps you up to date with all the latest breaking news from America and the rest of the world on BBC World News America. This world renowned news and current affairs program has been recognised for its exceptional reporting at the Emmy Awards. You can catch up with this award winning broadcast team as they air multiple times a day throughout the week.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest news from the BBC,which is designed to inform you on current affairs. The BBC is aims to be a totally impartial public service broadcaster, and was established by Royal Charter. The BBC is funded by a licence fee paid by British households, and is regulated by Ofcom. They aim to create high-quality content, in order to inform and educate, but also entertain, their audience Millions of people from all over the world watch content produced by the BBC, and they are well respected as a media company. It was founded in 1922, with its headquarters in Westminster, London.

programme.title: Newsday
programme.desc: "Good Morning Asia, hello World." Join the news teams from BBC World News in London and Singapore. This live news and current affairs program is broadcast globally and focuses on all the latest news and breaking developing stories that matter around the world. The show is usually presented by Rico Hizon in Singapore and Kasia Madera in London. Broadcasting live at midnight GMT on both BBC World News and the BBC News channel, the show is broadcast in the morning in Asia and therefore is marketed as a morning show for people watching around the country. The show is often followed by Asia Business Report live from Singapore which reports on all the latest economy and business figures from the country.

programme.title: The Travel Show
programme.desc: Join the Travel Show team as they take you on a criss-cross journey across the globe, visiting the most popular holiday destinations as well as sampling some hidden gems. The itinerary includes up-and-coming hot spots for holidaymakers and uncovering some lesser-known facts about places on many peoples bucket lists. This BBC programme takes you to every corner of the planet, providing an all-round insight into the world of travel. From winter wonderland activities such as eco skiing in Denmark and trekking across glaciers in Iceland, to warmer destinations as diverse as Rwanda and the Great Barrier Reef in Australia, your adventure starts here.

programme.desc: Focus on Africa is a BBC news program broadcast globally and on local partner channels of the BBC in African countries. The program includes news, sport and business from across Africa and the rest of the globe. Get the top African stories and keep up with the latest international events.

programme.title: Unspun World with John Simpson
programme.desc: A round-up of all the weeks most important news stories, with in-depth reporting and reliable, honest viewing. programme.title: Talking Business
programme.desc: On Talking Business BBC presenters, based in the worlds most dynamic cities, discuss with the most important and influential people from the world of business and finance, the key issues of the day. Corporate leaders, global investors, top creatives, cutting-edge entrepreneurs and leading intellectuals gather together weekly to discuss and analyse the issues and trends that most affect how business has to work in todays world. Our team of presenters are experts on the issues and developments which are shaping the way we work, consume and live in the 21st Century.

programme.title: Is Greenland For Sale?
programme.desc: US president Donald Trump says he wants the US to take over Greenland. The country is part of the Kingdom of Denmark, and Mr Trump says Denmark should give it up for the defence of the free world. Many people think it will never happen. But could it? If so, how? In this programme, we hear what Mr Trump has said. We gauge the reaction in Greenland and Denmark. And we ask why the US might want greater control over Greenland, and how likely it is to happen.

programme.title: Talking Movies
programme.desc: Join for the latest news from the world of film, including everything from documentaries to mainstream, indie and world cinema. The presenter travels all over the world, attending the greatest festivals and exclusive premieres, interviewing all the biggest stars, which over the years included big names such as Jude Law, Catherine Zeta Jones, Eathan Hawke, Ben Kingsley, Sally Hawkins and many others. The show also explores the newest trends and issues in the world of cinema.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest news from the BBC,which is designed to inform you on current affairs. programme.title: Valisilma dokk
programme.sub-title: Trump, Ukraine and Europe on the Edge
programme.desc: The BBCs flagship documentary series is the longest-running consumer and political affairs programme of its kind, with journalists and researchers delving into heavyweight topics from the worlds of finance, healthcare, criminal justice and the environment. The series has won a host of media industry awards for its fearless undercover investigations, as well as its hard-hitting interviews with politicians and business leaders. Panoramas reporters cover both national and international affairs, focusing on scandals and events which can impact on the ordinary consumer, taxpayer and voter. A wide range of subjects fall within the programmes remit, from the ethics of medical research and big-pharma to the funding of sports, the arts and the travel business. A Panorama investigation can make or break reputations, trigger police and audit inquiries, and pile pressure on governments at home and abroad.

programme.title: Bloomberg Balance of Power
programme.desc: Informational programme covering stories about worldwide politics, business and everything in between. The journalists report on the top news stories from these two fields, and interview experts who share their thoughts on a wide range of relevant topics.

programme.title: Bloomberg the Asia Trade
programme.desc: Live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping markets.

programme.title: Bloomberg
programme.desc: Yvonne Man and David Ingles give global investors unique insight into Chinas economy, with in-depth analysis and conversations with newsmakers.

programme.title: Insight with Haslinda Amin
programme.desc: The definitive guide for global news audiences to get the complete picture on the biggest story of the day, through probing interviews and nuanced conversations.

programme.title: Bloomberg Horizons Middle East and Africa
programme.desc: Linking the market drivers from overnight in the US and across Asia into the regions trading day, with deep dive analysis of the top business, energy and geopolitical stories shaping decisions.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak
programme.desc: Dont miss the latest and most important business news and stories from European markets, Wall Street, because overnight there is morning in Europe and around the world. The programme is hosted by Nejra Cehic, live from London with the help from Manus Cranny and some other hosts.

programme.title: Bloomberg
programme.desc: Everything you need to know as markets open across Europe. We break down the biggest stories of the day and speak to guests with skin in the game. Hosted by Anna Edwards, Guy Johnson and Kriti Gupta.

programme.title: The Pulse with Francine Lacqua
programme.desc: Conversations with high profile guests in the beating heart of global business, finance and politics. We go wherever the story is, bringing you exclusive interviews and market-moving scoops.

programme.title: Bloomberg Brief
programme.desc: Delivering the market news, data and analysis you need to set your agenda.

programme.title: Bloomberg Surveillance
programme.desc: Take a look at the latest news in finance, economics and investment, most important business stories and the state of the markets as each day begins. Join hosts Tom Keene and Francine Lacqua, who broadcast live from New York to London each morning and discuss markets with various leaders in global finance and economics. Find out everything you need to know about stocks, bonds, currencies and commodities in Bloomberg Surveillance.

programme.title: Bloomberg Open Interest
programme.desc: Matt Miller, Katie Greifeld and Sonali Basak deliver the market-moving news you need to know to get a jump start on the US trading day.

programme.title: Bloomberg Technology
programme.desc: Hosted by Ed Ludlow from San Francisco, California, and Caroline Hyde in New York, this captivating show focuses on global technology, innovation, and the future of business. It features original reporting and interesting interviews with various tech newsmakers- venture capitalists, CEOs, start-up entrepreneurs, and analysts.

programme.title: Bloomberg Real Yield
programme.desc: Bloomberg Real Yield focuses on global issues and events that directly affect debt markets. Host Jonathan Ferro discusses stories from the fixed income world with the biggest names in the field. The show provides critical intelligence and analysis, allowing its audience to stay ahead of the competition.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets
programme.desc: Bloomberg TVs flagship markets programme, providing key insights, analysis and context at the market close. Its a highly intelligent look at the markets that misses nothing.

programme.title: Bloomberg Balance of Power
programme.desc: Informational programme covering stories about worldwide politics, business and everything in between. The journalists report on the top news stories from these two fields, and interview experts who share their thoughts on a wide range of relevant topics.

programme.title: Bloomberg Businessweek
programme.desc: Follow presenters Carol Massar and Jason Kelly as they provide viewers with anecdotes and insights behind the articles found in award-winning magazine Bloomberg BusinessWeek. Anchors cover the breaking business news, while the writers and editors of the magazine share their views on various topics.

programme.title: Bloomberg the Close
programme.desc: Alix Steel, Romaine Bostick and Scarlet Fu own the market-moving breaking news around the closing bell in this must-watch daily program to get an edge on equities, earnings and the economy.

programme.title: Bloomberg Balance of Power
programme.desc: Informational programme covering stories about worldwide politics, business and everything in between. The journalists report on the top news stories from these two fields, and interview experts who share their thoughts on a wide range of relevant topics.

programme.title: Bloomberg Wall Street Week
programme.desc: Join David Westin as he dissects the latest stories and movements from Wall Street, inviting informed guests and financial experts to provide their thoughts and analysis regarding the market. He examines the impact that the current environment is having on businesses and traders, whilst looking ahead to peruse the likely changes across the financial industry. Whether its CEOs, professors or politicians, each offer their forthright opinions on the financial positives and negatives across the USA, evaluating the significance of the present climate and how they believe the country can continue to improve.

programme.title: The Circuit
programme.desc: How Youtube Became Must Watch TV. Emily Chang speaks with YouTube CEO Neal Mohan about the creator economy, staying atop the AI wave and transforming the platform into the worlds biggest streamer.

programme.title: Best of the Bloomberg Women, Money and Power Event
programme.desc: Highlights of the event which brings together the most influential female voices in finance from around the world to discuss the biggest themes facing the future of business.

programme.title: Posthuman
programme.sub-title: Your Brain Is the Next Tech Frontier

programme.title: Bloomberg Wall Street Week
programme.desc: Join David Westin as he dissects the latest stories and movements from Wall Street, inviting informed guests and financial experts to provide their thoughts and analysis regarding the market. He examines the impact that the current environment is having on businesses and traders, whilst looking ahead to peruse the likely changes across the financial industry. programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Gumball, Darwin and Anais discover that Banana Joes mom paints pictures which predict the future. When they find one that depicts Gumball running naked through the mall, Gumball is determined not to let it come to pass. However events conspire against him, and Gumball learns that sometimes you cant fight fate.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: When Mr Small shows a health and safety video in class, Darwin becomes obsessed with the idea of keeping the Wattersons safe. He tries to protect them from the world around them and soon Darwins over-protective control-freakery spreads to every corner of Elmore. The Wattersons have no choice but to overthrow his despotic regime.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Anais throws a party but no-one shows up as she has no friends or social skills. Gumball and Darwin help Anais make up an imaginary friend who, much to all their surprise, appears in front of them. Gumball and Darwin teach Anais and her new friend how to become friends, but soon realise that he might not be so imaginary after all...

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: The citizens of Elmore are feeling down because its January so Gumball and Anais invent a new holiday called Sluzzle Tag. / In Biology class Gumball and Darwin are waiting for a butterfly to emerge from its chrysalis. / After Gumball and Darwin have too much sugary cereal they begin thinking about the mysteries of the universe. / Gumball Darwin and Anais discover that Banana Joes mom paints pictures which predict the future. / When Mr Small shows a health and safety video in class Darwin becomes obsessed with the idea of keeping the Wattersons safe. / Anais throws a party but no-one shows up as she has no friends or social skills. / Alan is so good-natured that Gumball feels compelled to make him lose his temper. / Things arent going Gumballs way at school so he assumes there must be a Secret Society...

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: When Gumball and Darwin realise Grandpa Louie has no friends on Elmore Plus, they feel bad. So they create one - called Muriel. However when Granny Jojo finds out Louie has been spending time online with another woman, Muriel not existing isnt going to stop her being destroyed.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: The Wattersons discover a family of cartoon copycats who mimic their every move. / Grandpa Louie has a new online friend - the only problem is she isnt real. / The kids find out that Richard has been being picked on by the same person since high school. / Gumball and Darwin decide to use online reviews to wrangle free stuff. / A mysterious package shows up at the Wattersons house and they do their best to avoid opening it. / Darwin likes a girl in his class so Gumball decides its time to play cupid. / Gumballs smart answers arent the correct ones and hes forced to go back to kindergarten. / Gumball and Darwin discover the real reason Dads diet wasnt working. / Gumball discovers that Rob his old nemesis is neme-seeing someone else now.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: When Dad gives Larrys Hairdressers a bad review for saying hes bald, he gets offered a free haircut. This inspires Gumball and Darwin to go on a reviewing-spree across town, forcing Larry to give them stuff with the threat of a bad review. Just because the customer is always right doesnt mean that what theyre doing isnt wrong.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: The Wattersons receive an unmarked package in the mail. To distract themselves from the urge to open it, they all take turns to imagine what it might contain. To Mom it could mean financial freedom, to Gumball it could mean superpowers: to whoever its actually for, it means theyre not getting their package.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.sub-title: The Tag / The Party / The Man / The Microwave
programme.desc: Gumball and Darwin get caught in the middle of a trash can war between Richard and Mr. Robinson. / Gumball and Darwin are invited to a high school party, and have to bring a date! / Granny Jojo has brought a boyfriend to her birthday meal and Dad isnt happy about it. / Gumball and Darwin accidentally create a loveable monster that eats their family.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Miss Simian discovers a failed test from Gumballs past that brings down his grade point average. This means he has to retake kindergarten all over again, much to her delight. But by demoting him Miss Simian has inadvertently brought herself down, and theyre left with no choice but to team up if they want things back to normal.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Gumball and Darwin discover the reason Dads diet wasnt working was that he was actually on ten diets: and eating a meal for each of them. They eventually manage to help him lose weight, but Richards newfound buffness also brings out his more obnoxious side.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Gumball discovers that Rob, his old nemesis, is "neme-seeing" someone else now. Devastated that Rob has fallen out of hate with him, Gumball refuses to accept that his ex-nemesis has moved on and does his best to sabotage Robs blossoming relationship with his new foe, Banana Joe.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: When they see the school bullies making fun of Sussie Gumball and Darwin decide to try and help her act less weird. They carefully observe her behavior and decide that the only thing they have to change is absolutely everything.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Nicole has decided its time to throw out the familys refrigerator. This doesnt go down too well with Richard as its his favorite possession. When it turns out the refrigerator is also a magical storage facility for childhood emotions and memories it makes sense that Richard is having a hard time letting go.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Principal Brown gives Gumball and Darwin the ancient school hamster, Chris Morris, to look after for the weekend. However they accidentally leave it at school, and take home a clump of Principal Browns hair instead. Surprisingly they discover it makes an excellent pet! When they realise they have left the real Chris Morris at school, they have to race to find him before their error is discovered.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: When Darwin and Gumball reveal how theyd spend their perfect day, Gumball confesses that he would spend it with Penny. Darwin gets jealous and sets out to dig some dirt on Penny, hoping it will split them up. Meanwhile Gumball is planning to step his and Pennys relationship up a notch, by proposing marriage!

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Granny Jojo has brought a boyfriend to her birthday meal and Dad isnt happy about it. He bans Granny JoJo from ever seeing Louis again. When the kids get caught sneaking Granny Jojo out of the house, Dad challenges Louis to a man-off to prove once and for all who is the man of the house?!!

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: The Wattersons complain about their day and order a pizza from Larry. When they call to complain about their late pizza its the final straw for Larry and he quits all of his jobs. Elmores fragile commercial structure collapses and the citizens revert to a more primitive apocalyptic state.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: The citizens of Elmore are feeling down because its January, so Gumball and Anais invent a new holiday called Sluzzle Tag. The whole town embrace this festival and get excited about the arrival of the Sluzzle Dude; leaving it to Gumball and Anais to keep everyones Sluzzle Tag dreams alive.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: In Biology class, Gumball and Darwin are waiting for a butterfly to emerge from its chrysalis. Miss Simian warns them about the Butterfly Effect whereby the flap of an insects wings can start a tornado on the other side of the world. Paying no heed, Gumball releases the emergent butterfly into the wild, where it causes havoc upon Elmore.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Things keep going missing in the house, so its up to Gumball and Darwin to find the culprit. They discover that a mysterious person has been secretly living in their home. Gumball and Darwin manage to turn this confused squatter into their mortal enemy.

programme.title: Total DramaRama

programme.title: Total DramaRama
programme.desc: Total DramaRama is canadian animated comedy series, spin-off of Total Drama, all characters are already well-known and loved by the audience. This time Duncan, Gwen, Courtney, Izzy, Noah, Bridgette and the rest find themselves in the past as kids and their adventures take place in kindergarten. The strict Chef Hatchet is there to keep his eye on them. Any harmless idea of the kids turns out to be a total disaster, they are irrepressible in producing new ideas on how to have fun. the kids are discussing every single decision and plan in front of the cameras just like their adult versions, being a part of a reality show.

programme.desc: After failing to open a jar Chef believes hes past his prime and entering his twilight years. This prompts Beth and the kids to dig up something from his youth to rejuvenate him. That something turns out to be a ventriloquist dummy named Sue.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: When Mom wins Employee of the Month at the Rainbow factory, Richard feels like he is never celebrated for all the work he does at home. programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: The family have waited in line outside the movie theatre all night. They are devastated when Larry tells them they wont get into the first screening of the Stellar Odyssey sequel. But, hardcore fans that they are, the Wattersons are determined to be the first to see the movie and so set about battling their way to the front of the queue.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Join the citizens of Elmore for a song and dance spectacular that will have you covering your ears with joy.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: While searching the attic for items to put in their yard sale, Gumball and Darwin stumble upon a load of their old toys. Darwin is especially pleased when he finds his old puppets, Frank and Howdy. However, as Darwin starts playing with them again, Gumball gradually realises that Frank and Howdy are actually playing with Darwin...

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Gumball spends all day with Bomb Kid who discovers that he may well be unprankable.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: When Mr Corneille shows up to work with a mysterious bruise, Gumball and Darwin discover that hes teacher by day and a cage fighter by night, or was until he vowed never to fight again. However when the school is being closed for a lack of finances the boys have to try and convince him to come out retirement for one last fight.

Only Raven is immune to Roses insults and the two decide to hang out and do cool stuff together.

programme.title: Totally Spies!
programme.desc: Fights are breaking out all over Singapore as strange creatures with hairy feet cause trouble and "troll" people. The Spies are sure their friendship wont be affected but when it is, Mandy comes to the rescue- and the villain is linked to a past enemy.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Anais has been facepalming every time her family does something stupid, which has led to a serious medical condition.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Gumball tries to convince Leslie hes an expert on all things plant-related. However, when Leslie realises Gumball hasnt got a clue what hes talking about, he decides to call his bluff. An escalation of dangerous dares and stunts ensue as they try to out-plant each other.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Dad has to make the kids on time for their first day back at school. But hes overslept and now he cant find Gumball, Darwin or Anais anywhere. programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Gumball and Darwin discover that Rob, who once swore to wreak vengeance on them, has been trying to destroy them for some time. But his traps never work. Taking pity on him, the kids make it their mission to help Rob become a better nemesis. But they do their job too well, creating a super-villain they may not be able to control.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: The Amazing World of Gumball revolves around the life of Gumball Watterson, a 12-year-old cat who attends middle school in the fictional city of Elmore. Accompanied by his adoptive goldfish brother and best friend Darwin, he frequently finds himself involved in various shenanigans around the city, during which he interacts with his other family members - sister Anais and parents Nicole and Richard - and an extended supporting cast of characters. With relatable themes and a unique cast of characters, The Amazing World of Gumball exemplifies the funny, amazing, sweet and optimistic side of kids everyday life. Injected with a good deal of humor and unpredictable nonsense, Gumballs world reflects the modern family and everyday issues that kids understand.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Richards got a motorcycle helmet stuck on his head, so when he goes into a bank the terrified staff all assume hes there to rob the place and hand over a load of cash. Richard leaves with the money, completely oblivious to the fact hes just performed a stick-up. Nicole and the kids soon tell him what hes done and try to figure out a way to avoid the police manhunt and return the cash.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: The Lemmings have a new playmate: a walrus! The rodents ride the creature throughout the cabin, then make him slide down the roof before starting all over again. Grizzy steps in and propels the creature to the back of a mysterious ice cave. In the center is a dolmen with a bone sitting on it. Whoever touches the bone becomes docile and prehistoric in appearance. The Lemmings dream up a scheme where Grizzy would submit to their will.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: When Grizzy goes fishing, the Lemmings jump on the opportunity to transform the cabin into a giant ice slide. Upon his return, the bear puts an end to the rodents bobsleigh party and gets ready to savor his days catch. But the Lemmings steal his fish and draw the bear outside the cabin. Grizzy must try to recover his lunch while protecting his territory from a rodent invasion.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy pinches a magic statue from the Lemmings that has the power to make objects appear in real life. All you have to do, is pin the photo of ones desires upon it. Too bad for the rodents snow-bike! Grizzy replaces the vehicles photo with the portrait of his beloved she-bear who stayed behind in Canada. Barely arrived in African, the she-bear disappears again, victim of the rodents trickery. It is the outbreak of a bitter dispute.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Annoyed by the Lemmings new magnetic train, Grizzy propels the whole lot of them far from the cabin. The rodents land in the neighboring hut of a sorcerer and a mysterious mask falls onto one of them, endowing him with the power of telekinesis. The Lemmings are thrilled! They return to the cabin to explore this new magic power. Perched upon pieces of furniture, they fly around the room to finish their life-size flying train game!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy chases after the Lemmings, who have loaded a jar of Yummy into their remote-control driven car. Where the bear gets to the gas station, he destroys the vehicle and recovers the chocolate spread. The rodents find little mini-cars and chase Grizzy all the way back to the cabin, where they trip him up and intercept the coveted jar. Helpless, the bear sets out after them, until he runs into a tank truck filled with Yummy.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: To recover the jar of Yummy that Grizzy confiscated from them, the Lemmings decide to infest the bears coat with fleas. The scheme works and Grizzy starts scratching himself frenetically. Nonetheless, the bear manages to counter their diversion and expulse the rodents. When they land on a sorcerers hut, the Lemmings take possession of a magic scepter that has the ability to temporarily shrink objects. Now microscopic-sized, the rodents return to the cabin to get their paws on the chocolate spread.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy wakes up starving but the cupboards are empty. While the Lemmings play nearby with an elephant, the bear swipes their peanut reserves. Not at all pleased, the rodents decide to recover their bag of nuts and use the elephants trunk like a powerful vacuum cleaner to hurl all sorts of objects at Grizzy. In the heat of the battle, the Lemmings discover a pack of fabulous peanut and chili pepper cookies that seem to make the pachyderm ultra-powerful.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy is about to start eating the last remaining food in the cabin: cocktail snacks. But the sly Lemmings get there first. A fight breaks out but is quickly cut short by the unexpected visit of a wart hog. The pig devours the crackers and then, using his snout, detects a forgotten old package of candy under the bed, which he also proceeds to gobble down. Everyone realizes that the creature has the ability to find food. Grizzy and the Lemmings fight over who will follow the beast to track down food.

programme.desc: The Wicked Witch is quite sick of Christmas and has a plan to ruin the festivities this year. She bewitches this years tree, Tall Tim, to freeze everyone and everything in Oz as soon as the Christmas Eve party begins! When Dorothy and friends have no way to stop Tall Tims rampage, they figure out that the Wicked Witch is behind all this. They realize the only way to stop her is by melting her icy heart! Or else Oz will be frozen solid!

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: With Oz nearly completely frozen and the Wicked Witchs plan almost complete, Dorothy and friends get the idea to re-stage A Christmas Carol, disguise themselves as ghosts, and visit the Wicked Witch in the night to get her to change her wicked ways. When it backfires and the Wicked Witch is enjoying her evil deeds too much, they have to think quickly to get her to reverse the spell and unfreeze Oz!

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: The Wicked Witch has a plan to lure Dorothy and her friends to a made-up Ozian Carnival to get them on a roller coaster thatll send them all the way to the underground Land of Naught forever!

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: After paying a visit to Dr. Pipt and his lab the Wicked Witch gets her hands on the 3-in-1 potion that will combine any three objects into one! She decides to use it on Dorothy and her friends.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: When Ozma holds a fancy dress-up party at Emerald Castle, everybody whos anybody shows up. Including Wilhelmina, in disguise as "Sandra St. Nice" and clearly up to something.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Joonisfilm raagib grislikarust nimega Grizzy ja mitmest lemmikust.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: When he accidentally sticks a computer microprocessor to his temple, Grizzy is transformed into an exceptionally intelligent being capable of predicting events to come far in advance. With his way above average IQ, not only will he be able to provide himself with the latest high-tech comfort, getting rid of the Lemmings should be a piece of cake.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mrs. Wickets Nephew is staying with her when he wins two tickets to an Outward Bound course. She refuses to go but then ropes in Bean to look after the child. / Whilst out snapping nature with his camera Mr Bean gets angry when nature snaps back. / Bean discovers that in the world of organised crime a teddy isnt always a teddy. Sometimes its a rabbit. / Mr Bean cant find a parking space so he makes one of his own.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: When Mr. Bean finds a fly in his room, its war. He needs weapons. Fly spray? A rolled-up magazine? These are only the start. In desperation, he enlists a mouldy doughnut, an encyclopaedia, an upside-down dustbin and a club-hammer. Finally, Bean becomes the first man in history to wage war on a fly... with a fridge.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: A leisurely stroll in the park turns into a run when Mr. Bean is chased home by an angry Mime Artist. He is lost for more words than usual when the street performer makes himself at home and insists on being wined and dined. Bean ousts the pest from his house using the only language mime artists understand.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: A mockingbird relentlessly mocks Tom and Jerry and the insults really fly when the eggs hatch and the baby mockingbirds taunt the cat too. Time for these birds to fly the coop! / The witch sisters are brewing their latest concoction. / After working hard to get Tom to drift off to sleep Jerry heads for the coveted wedge of cheese in the kitchen. / Butch and Meathead dont want to miss a marathon of their favorite show so they make a deal with Tom to trade a little TV time for a treasure map. / Feeling bad for giving Toms precious blanket to Badwill, Jerrys determined to get it back. Unfortunately, retrieving gifted items from Badwill is not easy. / Tom gets a can of Cat Cop a spray that creates a tiny cop. Director: Darrell Van Citters,.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: When the Witch Sisters are brewing up their latest concoction, they discover that their stash of walnuts has disappeared. Needless to say, Jerry is enjoying the "nuts" of his labor, while Tom is sent out to gather more nuts. When Tom steals the winters supply of nuts from a feisty flying squirrel, things go from bad to worse. Not only does the squirrel take Jerrys stash, but the irate rodent launches an attack on Tom inside the house.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry accidentally get locked out in the snow. They chase each other in the winter wonderland until they realize they cant get back in. They work together to get back indoors as the weather turns ugly.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry fight each other with the balloons that Rick has placed all over the house.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: When Tom and Jerrys antics unearth an autographed baseball a childhood souvenir of Ricks he warns Tom to keep his paws off it or else! Tom attempts to obey but Jerrys got other ideas and the ball gets out of hand. The guys chase the treasured ball all over the neighborhood recovering it only to lose it again and again.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Tom finds himself trapped inside a Catsylvania bedtime story and fleeing from a furious Jabberwock.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Docs finally catch Lamput! Mission accomplished…and now they have nothing to do. Every other job to catch lab experiments gone rogue is a piece of cake compared to Lamput. Realizing that theyve lost their lives purpose, Specs and Skinny decide to break Lamput out of the labs hi-tech prison so that they can go back to catching him again.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: After the Docs constantly fail to catch Lamput with the power of science and technology, they come across an unlikely source to help them with their troubles - Magic! A witch offers them a magic marker that gives them any supernatural powers they draw on their skin. Lamput must now escape and Skinny with their new magical power!

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Lamput is caught but makes a new friend, Tuzki who comes to his rescue!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Clayface, Gotham Citys messiest villain, arrives to cause trouble during Gothams annual Clean Up Day. Redbird must overcome his fear of taking baths if hes going to help Bam bring Clayface to justice.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Animated adventure series for younger viewers that follows a team of five superpowered vehicles - Bam, Redbird, Bibi, Batwing and Buff - as they are thrust into hijinks and action while learning important lessons about teamwork, friendship and more. Everyone is ecstatic when Bibi, Batgirl and Robin capture Toyman and his Do-Over remote - everyone, that is, except for Bibi as she failed to stick her landing. Unwilling to accept her failure, Bibi uses Toymans Do-Over remote to perfect her jump...

programme.title: Alice and Lewis
programme.desc: Its panic stations in Wonderland! The Queen has ordered for Inverso to be captured in order to reverse various situations that are upsetting her: her empty jelly jars need to be filled and her little cakes need to be big! Unfortunately, her Cards have goofed, taking Reverso prisoner instead; he is Inversos son but he hasnt yet mastered his powers of inversion! Alice and Lewis must take Reverso back to his dad. Easier said than done when youre making the journey in a backward-driving caravan along a road where everythings topsy-turvy!

programme.title: Alice and Lewis
programme.desc: Alice accidentally pollutes Wonderlands lake by dropping a stinky Cutie-Twee in the water. The Queen is so offended by the stench that she can no longer live in her castle and decides she must move into Lewis home instead! This "roomie arrangement" goes south fast and the Queen ousts our friends with no more ado! So Alice and Lewis set about doing everything in their power to get Lewis house back, even if it means "rotting the life of the Queen !"

programme.title: Barneys World
programme.desc: When Vivie discovers shes not amazing at soccer the first time she tries, she thinks shell never be good at it. Barney creates fantastical practice drills to help Vivie learn how practice can help her get better.

programme.title: Barneys World
programme.desc: When Mels pretzel is eaten by a pigeon, Barney creates a high-seas adventure to find another, but it goes awry when Captain Mel doesnt listen to her crew. Mel realizes its important to listen to others when youre working as a team.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Skinny brings home the wrong laundry bag. Not a disaster, as it happens, since this particular laundry bag contains uncanny super-suits that grant mighty powers. The Docs get heat vision, amazing telekinesis rays, magnetic boots, you name it. All perfect for the person who dreams of… doing the household chores. With great power comes great boringness, apparently. After a satisfying day of getting the house spick n span, the penny finally drops for the Super-docs: they realise they have a far higher calling. Is it fighting evil and helping the underdog? Nope, its chasing Lamput, same as usual. Meanwhile, however, two actual superheroes really want their suits back. Turns out these heroes are quite into helping the underdog. Which is good news for Lamput, and very, very bad news for the Docs.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Tykes got a problem and it all began when the pup stepped on a wood plank. The same wood plank Tom discarded after using it as a hockey stick to slap Jerry (the puck) into the goal (the doghouse). Now Tykes got a painful splinter in his paw and since Tom was charged with watching him while a sickly Spike naps, Toms tasked with trying to remove the splinter before Spike wakes. Tom makes a few painful (for them both) attempts to remove the sliver with no success. Hearing Tykes whimpers, a sympathetic Jerry decides to help Tom out. In the end, Tom and Jerry get the splinter out but not before inflicting equal doses of pain while trying a myriad of home remedies from a hot bath, to tweezers, to adhesive tape, to glue, and more!

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Jerry brings Tom to consciousness. His partner has an aluminum bat on his head, arrow in his butt, bee stings on his arm, tire treads on his back, lipstick on his cheek and a terrible case of amnesia. Jerry must help Tom use the investigative clues on his body to solve what happened. The clues will take them to some destinations that may leave Tom more physically abused than when he started but in better mental shape (as each stop causes a little more memory to return).

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: We open on a SOLD sign in front of what will be Rick and Gingers house. Inside, the house is empty - no Rick, no Ginger, no Tom, no furniture. Just Jerry, who slip slides merrily across the bare floors - the place all to himself. That is until the front door opens and Rick and Ginger arrive in their new home. Ginger screams having just seen a mouse and tells Rick to get Tom out of the moving van. Like most cats in a new place, Tom doesnt want to come out from beneath the recently placed couch, but Ginger demands he catch that mouse! And so we watch the beginning of a lifelong adversarial relationship unfold one gag at a time!

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry are in the middle of it when Tom hears someone singing the tale of a cat who met his unfortunate, painful end chasing a much superior opponent. The song is about underestimating your opponent. Every time Tom stops chasing Jerry, the music stops. When Tom resumes, the music resumes. This back and forth continues until the chase takes Tom right past a Singing Uncle Pecos. Tom skids to a stop causing Uncle Pecos to stop singing. Tom wants to prove the lyrics of Uncle Pecos song wrong, but in the end, Toms ego proves to everyone, including himself, that he is very much the subject of Uncle Pecos cautionary tale.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: After another successful attempt on Jerrys part to elude Tom, Jerry overhears Rick and Ginger talk about the possibility of getting rid of that "useless cat." Rick makes the case that the cat, "just takes up space, only serves one function and doesnt even do that well," and, "they should replace it with something that can get the job done!" When Ginger sounds like shes considering the possibility, Jerry cant believe his ears! Jerry imagines life in the house with a killer cat and decides to do whatever he can to make sure Tom stays. Problem is, Tom thinks Jerrys flagrant attempts to get caught are a trap. In the end, Jerry finds out Rick was talking about that ugly cat doorstop that was a wedding present from Gingers Aunt Gracie. Unfortunately, Toms had enough of Jerrys taunting and is ready to take the bait!

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry accidentally get locked out in the snow. They chase each other in the winter wonderland until they realize they cant get back in. They work together to get back indoors as the weather turns ugly.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Not easy to enjoy a DVD about salmon when the Lemmings are having a disco party right there. Grizzy sends them packing with such force that they land at the research station, where they discover a state-of-the-art U.V. cabin. When turned up to the max, the light therapy and music options can advantageously replace the disco equipment Grizzy destroyed. The noise they make causes a block of ice to break off. It hurdles down the slope to the cabin and destroys Grizzys TV. But it doesnt take the bear long to figure out that the U.V. cabin also has a DVD function.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: The Lemmings have fun destroying ice towers. When Grizzy sees them, it inspires him to sculpt statues of himself. The Lemmings cannot resist the temptation to destroy the statues of Grizzy, who does everything in his power to protect them.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: A container adrift along the icefield will change the lives of Grizzy and the Lemmings: its an inexhaustible stock of chocolate spread! There is so much, that for the first time the close enemies have no need to fight over the treat. They entice a flock of penguins into hoisting the container out of the water. One of the penguins, who did not get his reward in fish, is disgruntled. Grizzy has him taste the Yummy, then throws the jar far away to get rid of the penguin. The chocolate treat spreads over the icefield. Fatal error?

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy uses a fire extinguisher to chase the Lemmings from the living room so that he can take a nap, but the gadget accidentally flies out the window. It lands at the top of an ice cliff, causing a fissure, and the peak of the cliff topples. Amid the debris, the Lemmings discover a fearsome creature: the Yeti, who is looking for the guilty party. The Lemmings bring him to Grizzy, never dreaming that the giant will immediately fall in love with the Rangers cabin and throw a very original party.
